Detailed Description

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
class stemming::russian_stem< string_typeT >

PERFECTIVE GERUND:
group 1: в вши вшись
group 2: ив ивши ившись ыв ывши ывшись

group 1 endings must follow а or я.

REFLEXIVE:
ся сь

NOUN:
а ев ов ие ье е иями
ями ами еи ии и ией
ей ой ий й иям ям ием
ем ам ом о у ах иях ях ы
ь ию ью ю ия ья я

Member Function Documentation

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::russian_stem< string_typeT >::operator() ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline]

Parameters:
text string to stem

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::russian_stem< string_typeT >::step_1 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Step 1: Search for a PERFECTIVE GERUND ending. If one is found remove it, and that is then the end of step 1. Otherwise try and remove a REFLEXIVE ending, and then search in turn for
(1) an ADJECTIVAL,
(2) a VERB or
(3) a NOUN ending.
As soon as one of the endings (1) to (3) is found remove it, and terminate step 1.

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::russian_stem< string_typeT >::step_2 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

If the word ends with и, then remove it.

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::russian_stem< string_typeT >::step_3 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

Search for a DERIVATIONAL (ост, ость) ending in R2 (i.e., the entire ending must lie in R2), and if one is found, then remove it.

template<typename string_typeT = std::wstring>
void stemming::russian_stem< string_typeT >::step_4 ( string_typeT &  text  )  [inline, private]

(1) Undouble н, or
(2) if the word ends with a SUPERLATIVE (ейш or ейше) ending, remove it and undouble н, or
(3) if the word ends ь then remove it.
